intro: Jacquinia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed jacquinia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are typically narrow and arranged in a compact, bushy habit. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, appearing in clusters and blooming in the spring. Jacquinia stenophylla thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude environments.
